data.title: Best of Boulder
data.text: This was our second visit to this wonderful B&B right in the heart of Boulder and we were not disappointed. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by the owner and staff who took genuine interest in our reason for visiting and making us feel welcome. Later when we returned from dinner, we were surprised by a dozen roses and gourmet chocolate bars celebrating our anniversary. Very nice touch. Our inviting room was spacious and the wood burning fireplace added a romantic touch. The bed was very comfortable and nice touches abound, combining modern functionality with vintage charm. A fully served breakfast was quite tasty and not of your run of the mill variety. We'll be back!

data.title: Bed and Breakfast get away
data.text: The staff were very helpful but only one introduced herself to us. They were responsive to our requests. The owners don't live on site, we saw one owner once and he didn't introduce himself either.  We had to ask if he was the owner.  The B&B is on a very busy road.  There is close access to a lovely walk along Boulder Creek.  Comfortable bed and large room with sitting area.  But overall impression of the B&B is "shabby", and not really worth the price.

owner_response.author: BRBB, General Manager at Briar Rose Bed and Breakfast, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your feedback and sincerely try to make improvements based on every one of our guests' concerns. Apologies for the only brief meeting he had with you folks the other day. Gary and Jessika have owned the Briar Rose, in the heart of the city of Boulder for a little over 13 years. For a great length of that time Jessika was the general manager and on site daily. Three years ago when they were blessed with their first and only child, Jessika decided to stay home with the bundle of joy and enjoy those fleeting joyful young child years. For multiple reasons, including the now 3-year-old daughter, they have chosen to live off-site and devote more space to guest rooms. In their stead, the passion that the current general manager has for the Briar Rose is unparalleled and the dedicated young staff take on the daily routine of operations (cooking/serving/cleaning/etc), allowing Gary time to meet with guests at breakfast several days a week and still afford time to go to his full-time job and home to his loving family each night. We do understand that this is not the typical living/owner situation as many B&B's but earnest intention of our outgoing staff is a level of friendly customer service to make up for the time that Gary is not here personally.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lovely BnB in Boulder
data.text: We spent one night in this lovely BnB in Boulder. Only about 5 minutes drive from Pearl St Mall area it is in a great location in this great Colorado city. Our room, on the ground floor was lovely and spacious. There are a few restaurants for dinner within a few blocks. Breakfast was good with a few options. Would highly recommend if you are lucky to be in Boulder

data.title: Convenient and charming option in Boulder
data.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find Briar Rose so convenient.  It's a short walk to Pearl Street or the 29th Street mall. The house is charming and the staff is most accommodating.  I had some dietary restrictions which they met and breakfast was delicious.  I also love their commitment to health and the environment which is reflected in the menu and toiletry products.  They have a great tea selection and are happy to serve you a pot upon request.  I will definitely be back for another stay!

data.title: Cute retreat in Boulder
data.text: I have stayed at every hotel in Boulder and was looking for something a little different. I really liked the Briar Rose and will stay again. The room was a bit dated but the bed was comfortable. Very clean room. Breakfast was very good however it is VEGETARIAN. I didn't mind but my husband likes his meat! The staff is pleasant and very helpful. The cookies were yummy and the tea selection outstanding. Very convenient to Folsom Stadium if you are going to a CU football game. Go Buffs!! Easily walked. Many restaurants within walking distance and bike rental right outside the door.

data.title: Oops, we forgot you were coming
data.text: We arrived at 9:15 their time and found the place locked up tight. A sign on the door invited us to call for the onsite manager. No answer. No problem... There was the number of the owner to call just in case... Still no answer. We waited about 30 minutes outside wondering what to do with paid confirmation in hand... Finally, an employee happened by (not responding to us) and he let us in. He couldn't find our reservation and had to dig through old emails to find us. Oops, we forgot to put you in the system and overbooked your room. Sorry - someone is in the room you booked. But, we will give you a free upgrade to the last room we have. The owner finally texted us and found out we were in. The next morning they apologized and gave us a 10% discount. Still a bit disappointed when we still paid over 200 for the room.

owner_response.author: BRBB, General Manager at Briar Rose Bed and Breakfast, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are so sorry at the trouble when you arrived. It was plain and simple human error. And while it is a late response, a better explanation of the issue is that the night staff person accidentally put the wrong name on the envelope (that was intended for you) on the door,  and the other staff person who arrived was utterly confused at the issue and gave you another room. This is a very atypical issue that we are humbled by and have intend to never repeat. We usually pride ourselves on service and friendly welcome to our B&B in the heart of the city of Boulder.  Please accept our apologies.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Cozy, Friendly & Close to Downtown
data.text: We were in Boulder on business to go to a concert at the Boulder Theater.  This B&B is close enough to walk to downtown in about 15 minutes.  We stayed in the Cameron room with the balcony.  The room was clean & cozy and since it was warm it was nice to have the balcony doors open and a sitting area outside.  The staff was very friendly and helpful with where to go in the area.  There is a parking lot for your car included in the room.  The breakfast was really nice.  Homemade granola, fresh coffee, juice, yogurt and breads.  We were also served eggs & potatoes.  Also you can't forget about the homemade cookies available.  The next time we are back in Boulder, we will definitely stay here.

data.title: Nice and convenient alternative to hotel
data.text: I stayed at the very conveniently located Briar Rose for 1 night in early July. My room was very comfortable with a hall bathroom (but it was for my use only). The only reason I am not giving it a 5 star rating is because the manager did not offer to help me carry my bags up the stairs to my room, and I thought the coffee at breakfast was only so-so.  However, the homemade, always available, signature shortbread cookies almost made up for those disappointments. I look forward to staying there again on my next visit to Boulder.

data.title: Very nice stay and look forward to returning
data.text: This place is very convenient to downtown Boulder, as it is a 3-4 min drive or a pleasant 10-15 min walk along interesting streets and shops and we walked on the paved well traveled trail by a stream to a festival downtown.  They have off street parking, beautiful gardens and a great breakfast, including homemade delicious granola with fresh fruit and yogurt.  The room we stayed in was very comfortable, commodious and well furnished.  We enjoyed sitting out in the yard or on the balcony in the evening.  The staff is very friendly, accomadating, and informative.  As a bonus, Boulder also offers free parking downtown at the parking garages on Saturday and Sunday.

data.title: comfortable with friendly service
data.text: I had a lovely room with a fireplace, private bathroom and a spacious seating area. The only negative was a bit of light seeping into the room in the AM from a skylight over the bed. A 15 minute walk to the downtown restaurant/bar area wasn't an issue in good weather. Breakfast was fun with a nice discussion around the table with other guests, but also room to sit alone if that's what you wanted.

data.title: Briar Rose Bed & Breakfast, a blossom of Bloulder!
data.text: My sister and I stayed for a few days at Briar Rose. We were taking her son back to the University nearby for his second year.  The room was very clean and inviting.  The entire staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful.  All the soaps, shampoos and such were all organic and lovely.  We had a fireplace in our room, didn't use it, as we stayed in the summer.  The breakfast both days were healthy and satisfying. All natural, and if you have a special dietary request, they'll oblige.  Sheets were crisp and clean.  The grounds are peaceful and lovely.  Just a 1/2 mile from the bustle of Pearl Street and the big Boulder Mall (can't remember the name.)   I will stay there again when I visit beautiful boulder.  This place is serene, feels like you are a guest in a close friends home.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: You will not go wrong staying here at this lovely B&B. Accommodations are very comfortable and they think of many little details that make your stay special. Breakfast is fantastic and they have the most adorable pots of freshly brewed tea and cookies served all day long on trays with flowers and honey pots. Really, why stay at a large hotel when you can feel like your pampered here. Beautiful gardens and terrific hospitality. Thanks for a great stay

data.title: comfy and convenient
data.text: Attended a weekend wedding, wife and I stayed at locale selected by bridal parents, along with 2 other couples.  Rooms were large, airy, and well maintained; staff friendly and helpful.  Food delicious, but, being an omnivore, breakfast meat was missed; that is my only "complaint."

data.title: Our Honeymoon stay! We loved the Briar Rose!
data.text: My husband and I are from Kentucky and we decided to, run away with short notice to Boulder, Colorado to get Married. Little did we know all the hotels were booked. We found the Briar Rose Bed and Breakfast out of pure luck. ( they had just received a two-night stay cancellation) we booked for two-nights June 15, June 16 2016. Not knowing what to expect seeing as this was our first bed & breakfast stay, I can say it was very wonderful. The bed and breakfast its self was very beautiful, the gardens are amazing, the tea was exceptional its a very relaxing environment, the street noise was a little loud, but we didn't mind it. I probably would not recommend this place for the party couples. It was very peaceful and stress free. Breakfast was nice a little different for us but still nice. Rooms were clean and comfy. We loved our staff they were incredible, some were a little odd at first I guess considering they were young and we come from two totally different parts of the US. Most of the staff were friendly and helped when ever we needed it. For example, the first nights stay my husband and I developed Altitude sickness we were miserable and the young guy in kitchen helped by recommending peppermint tea and brought it up to our room. Something else I must brag about the staff is they knew we had gotten married and they brought us roses champagne and chocolates on our wedding night. It was incredible, thank you Briar Rose for making our wedding/honeymoon stay better than we could have imagined.

data.title: A fine place to stay
data.text: I had a nice experience staying, as it was my first time in Boulder. The rooms were nice and breakfasts were prepared well and served by friendly people. I also really enjoyed the gardens and how close the location was to downtown. My only complaint is in regards to the staff: the gentleman who greeted me and checked me in was dressed extremely casually and had his shirt halfway open revealing a lot of his chest. Maybe this is the "natural" style of Boulder, but it was not something that I wanted to see when coming to a well reviewed B&B.

owner_response.author: BRBB, Manager at Briar Rose Bed and Breakfast, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your kind words about our Bed and Breakfast, we try to be a welcoming and homey place for guests to feel comfortable here and that should include the appropriate attire of our employees. This issue has been addressed with our staff.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Kinda different, all in a good way
data.text: We're a Baby Boomer couple who like staying at B&Bs and inns whenever we travel, and staying at the Briar Rose was certainly a fun way to see a slice of Boulder. Handy location -- we walked into town for dinner, for example -- and we enjoyed the extensive yet still cosy garden, the tea service in the evening out on the lawn, and the large, clean and comfortable room we had in the carriage house. The staff is young and friendly and there certainly were several of them, although since this is more of an inn it just doesn't have as personal an approach as you get at many B&Bs. Overall, though, there's definitely a laid back vibe in line with the meditation center on the premises. Breakfast was fine, although not as unique as we had thought we'd find -- a vegetarian scramble, a nice fruit bowl and some muffins. Some may be disappointed that there's plenty of street noise in the garden despite the walled enclosure, but we were OK. Comfy, if a little worn, public spaces; we viewed it all as homey and were happy. We're glad we stayed here.

data.title: Short but great stay
data.text: Arrived in Boulder for just a one night stay which from arrival til we left the Briar Rise B and B was exceptional. The room was perfect, clean and quiet and all who work there are the nicest and most accommodating. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!

data.title: Nice hotel with good location
data.text: Firstly let me say that the service was very good here and the services and location are good hence my very good score. But unfortunately I did/do feel let down by this place. When I booked I was told parking was including - when I arrived parking is only available for 7 cars and surrounding streets are restricted parking so had no parking. I booked a room with garden view - my room over looked the parking area on one side and the street on the other so no garden view.

owner_response.author: BRBB, Manager at Briar Rose Bed and Breakfast, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Rob, thanks so much for your kind words and helpful notes. We apologize for the inconvenience of parking, we are located in a city and parking is at a premium, so we try the best we can with the space we have. Future guests will be pleased to hear that just past the first intersection with parking limits in our neighborhood is a block of unlimited street parking. We will definitely try to assist better with parking arrangements. Additionally we sincerely did not mean to mislead you with the room names, the 3rd party site: Booking.com has generic room names and selected that name based on the view from the shared balcony that overlooks our side garden/patio area, and have since contacted them to correct the misleading title for the Windom room. We are very pleased that you appreciated our friendly staff and do hope you visit us again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lovely property, excellent service
data.text: The garden is stunning, the rooms are charming, and the staff is really friendly and welcoming. Breakfast is great - made to order with homemade granola and fresh baked goods every day. Ask them to show you the loose tea selection! I've stayed at the Briar Rose several times and never been disappointed.

data.title: I LOVE The Briar Rose!
data.text: The Briar Rose is a dreamy, beautiful, magical place surrounded with lovely gardens, fountains, delightful folks who work there and wonderful, beautiful rooms! The staff is so nice, so accommodating and helpful that it feels as if their entire focus is to make my stay as easy and fluid as possible. The breakfasts are fantastic, the place is decorated perfectly and they even have a wonderful meditation room in which they hold practice if you are interested. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this place- it really is just perfection in the ideal location to explore and enjoy Boulder! I cannot wait to return and would not think of ever staying anyplace else!!!
